1.brief: to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

2.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

3.brief: happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.

4.brief: properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity

5.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion

6.brief: properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
to be (causatively, do or declare) wrong; by implication, to disturb, violate

Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be (causatively, make or act) circumspect and hence, intelligent
properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
to be (causatively, make) bitter (or unpleasant); (figuratively) to rebel (or resist; causatively, to provoke)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory

to parch (through drought) i.e. (by analogy,) to desolate, destroy, kill
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
an abyss (as a surging mass of water), especially the deep (the main sea or the subterranean watersupply)
a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)

a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.)

water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to jut over or exceed; by implication, to excel; (intransitively) to remain or be left; causatively, to leave, cause to abound, preserve

a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause

13.brief: properly, to be liquid or flow easily, i.e. (by implication); to hurry (in a good or a bad sense); often used (with another verb) adverbially, promptly
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to adhere to; hence, to await
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence

a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)
to test; by implication, to attempt
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

a petition; by implication, a loan
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
